Award.AwardTitle: I-Corps: Distributed Ledger Technology as a Security and Tracking Mechanism for Online Gaming
Award.AbstractNarration: The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is the development of a technology for information, such as advertisements, to be placed securely in a dynamic format. One possible application is video games, with users surpassing 2.5 billion people worldwide (growing larger due to COVID-19). The proposed system is a secure, blockchain-enabled platform that could be used for the online gaming ecosystem. This is the first known use of distributed ledger technology (DLT) for such a use case. <br/><br/>This I-Corps project is based on the development of a DLT solution placing information in a closed dynamic digital system with no technical integration required for either party. While user data privacy is often violated on many traditional advertising platforms, the proposed technology ensures that usersâ€™ privacy is always protected. By using distributed ledger technology (DLT) instead of a third-party database, users retain full control over their data, which are protected from other access without explicit user permission. The proposed project will advance technology to deploy, track and optimize the system.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Throughout the I-Corps program, the team at Relentlo Inc. focused on testing the product market fit of their software development kit (SDK) that enables product placement advertising in video games. The goal was to identify whether there was a viable market for the product and what the potential demand might be.

The team conducted a total of 140 interviews with leading individuals in the advertising and video game industries to gather feedback and insights. These interviews helped the team to better understand the needs and interests of both brand advertisers and video game studios, which were the target customers for the product.

Based on the feedback gathered, the team was able to refine their product and develop a clearer understanding of its potential value to the market. They also identified key challenges and potential roadblocks that would need to be addressed in order to successfully bring the product to market.

Overall, the project was successful in achieving its goal of testing the product market fit of the SDK for product placement advertising in video games. The team gained valuable insights and feedback from industry leaders, which will be critical as they move forward with developing and launching the product. The team remains dedicated to growing Relentlo and bringing this innovative product to market.
